cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 260 mi SSW of Manzanillo, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: turning west-northwest tonight, then northwest to north-northwest, paralleling the Pacific coast of Mexico and tracking just offshore the Baja California peninsula toward the northern Baja/Southern California offshore waters late this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near, or just west of, Punta Eugenia on the central Baja California peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Loreto southward to Cabo San Lucas and Cabo San Lucas northward to Puerto San Andresito, southern Baja California peninsula
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-western mainland Mexico and the entire Baja California peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts 20–30 mph possible late week as Kay passes well offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture from Kay could bring 1–2 inches of rain to coastal southern California Friday–Saturday, with locally higher amounts in upslope terrain.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning late Thursday and peaking Friday–Saturday.
